title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 17, ch. IV, subch. B, pt. 131 - Accommodation Of Utilities Within State Highway Right-of-way
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 17, ch. IV, subch. B, pt. 131 - Accommodation Of Utilities Within State Highway Right-of-way

State Regulations
§ 131.1 - Scope of rules and regulations
§ 131.2 - Authority to occupy State highway rights-of-way
§ 131.3 - A review of statutory authority of certain utilities to use State highway rights-of-way
§ 131.4 - Public Service Law-article 7 installations
§ 131.5 - Definitions
§ 131.6 - Accommodation of utilities on highways with full control of access
§ 131.7 - Accommodation of utilities on highways with partial control of access
§ 131.8 - Accommodation of utilities on highways with no control of access
§ 131.9 - Depth of bury and vertical and lateral clearance
§ 131.10 - Lighting
§ 131.11 - Existing utility facilities
§ 131.12 - Exceptions
§ 131.13 - Abandoned facilities
§ 131.14 - Federal-aid highway projects
§ 131.15 - Scenic enhancement
§ 131.16 - Permits and agreements
§ 131.17 - Construction procedures
§ 131.18 - Electric power and communication lines
§ 131.19 - Underground work
§ 131.20 - Utility facilities on structures
§ 131.21 - Miscellaneous provisions
§ 131.22 - Insurance, undertakings and deposits

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 17, ch. IV, subch. B, pt. 131

Statutory authority: Highway Law, §§10, 30, 52, 103, 230, 249, 250; Transportation Law, §§14, 14b; General

Obligations Law, §11-102

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
